Case reference: 2014006619.CaseDesc: On November 5, 2008, Colo Flannel was seen for the last time as he left the Intervalle Centre in the Longue-Pointe District in Montreal, Quebec. Colo suffers from a paranoid personality disorder, and may have possibly returned to Haiti.

Case reference: 2014004946.CaseDesc: On April 21 2007, vehicle belonging to Richard Gallegos was found near the Niagara Falls, in Niagara Falls, Ontario. Richard has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2020007795.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1972, at around midnight, James Edwards was last seen in his Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) uniform leaving for work in Toronto, Ontario. TTC advised that James had submitted his resignation before his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014004993.CaseDesc: On the 5th of July, 2002, Percy McKenzie was last seen near Powell Island on Lac La Ronge lake, La Ronge, Saskatchewan. Percy was alone and the lake was very rough at the time. Searches failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2021044031.CaseDesc: David-Alexandre Beliveau was reported missing on September 27, 2021 and was last known to be in Calgary, Alberta on September 4, 2021. David has a number of unique tattoos on his hands, arm and back.

Case reference: 2014001837.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1979 at approximately 8:30 a.m. seven men departed from Anama Bay, Manitoba on a fishing trip. The men departed as a group in three separate boats and were heading for Warpath. At approximately 7:30 p.m. that same day, the occupants of the first boat reported to the RCMP that the other two boats were missing. They described the waves as being three to four feet high and they could not see the tree line from where they were. They lost sight of the other two boats and fired shotgun shots into the air hoping for a response. No response was received. Extensive patrols by air, boat and land were made in an attempt to locate the remaining five men. The bodies of Fredrick Ursu and Jerry Hudy were never recovered. Mr. Ursu and Mr. Hudy are presumed dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2017023773.CaseDesc: On April 18, 2017 the body of an unidentified man was recovered from the Ottawa River near Wendover, Ontario. Biogeographic Ancestry testing predicts this man was either of European ancestry, or Middle Eastern/North African ancestry, or mixed European and Middle Eastern/North ancestry.

Case reference: 2013000103.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1969,  three commercial fishermen sold their catch, purchased groceries and departed Jackpine Island for Brochet via Reindeer Lake. Mr. Bighetty left in his own canoe and was ahead of two other men who were also travelling by canoe. The second canoe later had mechanical problems and had to stop on an island. The two men indicated that they had heard the other canoe and figured it was Mr. Bighetty coming back to look for them. However, they never saw him again. Mr. Bighetty's canoe was located in the lake in a vertical position 9.6 kilometers south of Brochet. It is presumed he drowned and no foul play is suspected in this matter.

Case reference: 2006008799.CaseDesc: Doris Fennell was last observed at the home of an acquaintace in Kitley-Elizabeth Township, near Addison, Ontario. Foul Play is strongly suspected in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2016055037.CaseDesc: Human remains were found on May 10, 2006 in a field near Mossleigh, AB. They are believed to be those of a female, over the age of 40, possibly of Caucasian or Aboriginal descent, who was between 5’2” and 5’6”. The individual was missing teeth and likely wore an upper denture. The individual may have complained of joint pain due to arthritis. The remains appear to have been there from 1 to 5 years

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Cheek, Healed fracture of right cheek bone
Mark: Right Side Of Head, Large button osteoma on right side of forehead

Case reference: 2014045101.CaseDesc: The partial remains of an older adult female were found near Chasm, British Colombia in 2010. She had no teeth in her lower jaw and had likely gone missing many years earlier.

Case reference: 2014005195.CaseDesc: Tommy Charpentier worked on a farm and lived with his employer in Sainte-Brigitte-des-Saults. On the night of December 15, 2008, tracks in the snow indicate that he may have walked on the Nicolet River that passes in front of the farm. Mr. Charpentier’s clothes were found on the frozen surface of the river, near an opening in the ice. This suggests that Mr. Charpentier may have jumped into the icy waters of the Nicolet River.

Scar: Ears, Right ear piercing without earring.
Chest, Left nipple piercing without a ring

Case reference: 2014002023.CaseDesc: Lara Brown was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in September 1998.  Lara was last heard from by a friend at the end of August 1998.

Case reference: 2015019929.CaseDesc: On April 16, at approximately 9:00 a.m., Sribavan Kandasamy was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016041786.CaseDesc: LeRoi La France was reported missing on March 31, 2016 when LeRoi’s siblings learned that a formal missing person report had never been made regarding their brother. He was last seen in October or November of 1964. In 1964 LeRoi was a student at UBC who lived in Burnaby BC and insured a 1952 VW Beetle.

Case reference: 2018012254.CaseDesc: On March 5, 2018, at approximately 10:50am, Mary Owusu was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Blue, Parka with a fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2018016267.CaseDesc: Yvette Bourgon was seen for the last time in Montreal on approximately January 1, 1965. Mrs. Bourgon was hospitalized at Louis-H Lafontaine, formerly known as St-Jean-de-Dieu. Mrs. Bourgon's footprints were found in the snow near the Lachine Canal in Verdun. Her purse was found without her wallet in close proximity to the footprints.

Case reference: 2014003009.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 30, 1979, Adolphe Thorassie and three hunting partners were attempting to return home after a successful hunt. Two men were in each boat. On the return trip the men had to go to shore once to get out of the winds. They again departed despite the high winds on the lake which was causing the water to be extremely dangerous with high waves. Adolphe was in the lead boat with his hunting partner, and unbeknownst to him the second boat had to return to shore for motor repairs. Adolphe and his hunting partner never returned and were reported missing the next day. The body of Adolphe's hunting partner was discovered and the cause of death was determined to be drowning. It is assumed Mr. Thorassie also drowned.

Case reference: 2014002495.CaseDesc: Linda Scott was reported missing to the Edmonton Police Service in April 2000. Linda was last heard from by a family member in March 2000. She is normally in contact with family at least once a week. Linda was believed to be last seen with friends.

Case reference: 2014003833.CaseDesc: On September 27, 1975, Barry Kelly was seen for the last time at the Speak-Easy Steakhouse in Niagara Falls, New York, in the United States. He never returned to his Niagara Falls, Ontario, home. At the time of his disappearance, Barry was despondent, and he has not been seen or heard from since.

Jewelry: Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Watch
Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Chain, Around neck
Sweater: Orange, Brown, Hooded, Hooded with stripes

Case reference: 2014006180.CaseDesc: Tammy Penner has not been in contact with friends or family since 2005. Tammy did not live in one place for any significant period of time, and has traveled across Canada. Prior to her disappearance, she had been living in Chilliwack and Abbotsford in British Columbia. Tammy suffered from a drug dependency.

Case reference: 2019030954.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2019, Tara Sculptor was seen for the last time by her mother on Carling Avenue in Ottawa, Ontario. It is possible that Tara took a bus from Ottawa to North Bay, Ontario.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, A bald spot on the back of the head
Scar: Forehead, Severe burns to the face
Right Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Left Leg, Skin graft removed from rear
Back Of Head, Skin graft removed from behind

Case reference: 2014005031.CaseDesc: Eric Gagnon was seen for the last time over the course of the night on May 25-26, 1996 in Trois-Pistoles, Quebec. Eric drove his ex-girlfriend to "Le Bellevue" Night Club sometime in the early hours of the evening. His vehicle was later recovered at his home.

Case reference: 2012030001.CaseDesc: In April 2011, both parents took their son, Aleksander to visit the mother's family in Poland. The father came back to Canada on his own on May 13, 2011. The mother, Elzbieta Nowacki and child did not return to Canada.

Case reference: 2014005612.CaseDesc: Carol Handy was last seen on March 16, 2011 in Edmonton, Alberta. Her family heard her leave her bedroom at approximately 2:30 am. She has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2014005172.CaseDesc: Debra Marlow was last seen in Kingston Ontario on November 3rd, 2008, where she had a mental health assessment at Kingston General Hospital. She was despondent at that time, and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2017020043.CaseDesc: Louis Judah Gonick was seen being picked up by taxi cab at his University dormitory residence at 7:09 PM, April 16, 2017, and was last seen at 7:32 PM, being dropped off at the Stanley Park causeway.

Case reference: 2006023499.CaseDesc: Viola Panacheese was last seen on August 18, 1991 walking on Lakeshore Avenue in Sioux Lookout, Ontario.  Ms. Panacheese wears glasses but was not wearing them at the time of her disappearance.

Scar: Right Shin, burn scar from knee to ankle

Case reference: 2020041548.CaseDesc: On June 4, 2020, Horacio Calderon Alvidrez was last seen moving out from his residence in New Westminster, British Columbia. Horacio has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2023012025.CaseDesc: On March 6th, 2023 shortly after 12:00 pm, Kimberly Jackson was last seen in the area of Prospect Point, American Falls, in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of her disappearance Kimberly was despondent.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Samurai skull with a knife

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2013000041.CaseDesc: David Luborksy was reported missing on the 4th of November 2010. Mr. Luborksy was last seen leaving the Parklane Residence which is situated at 1095 Merivale Road, in the City of Ottawa.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Irishman holding a beer
Right Side Of Neck, Clover leaf

Case reference: 2019065945.CaseDesc: On November 13, 2019, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Shane Kowerko was seen for the last time as he left a friend’s residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Shane did not tell his friend where he was going, and left his winter jacket there.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Girl holding baseball bat
Right Side Of Neck, Jiminy Cricket
Right Forearm, Chinese writing 5 characters (woman, word, name)

Case reference: 2012020130.CaseDesc:
Mario Marabella, 40 years old, was on his way to a meeting when he was abducted on December 4, 2008 in Laval.  Mr. Marabella was at a service station on Highway 440 between Hwys. 19 and 25 around 4:00 p.m. when three people forced him into a van and fled. 

Mr. Marabella's car, a grey Acura MDX was retrieved around 8:00 p.m. that evening by one or more of the abductors at the same Petro-Canada station from which Mr. Marabella was abducted. A few hours later the car was found burning at the corner of Gouin Boulevard and Lambert St. in Montréal.  Mr. Marabella was known to be involved in organized crime.  He was linked to the Italian Mafia.

Deformity: Abdomen, excess skin due to weigh lost
Scar: Abdomen, operation on abdomen for weight loss

Case reference: 2013000016.CaseDesc: Marjorie Ferris was reported missing when she did not show up in London, Ontario, where she was to visit friends. Her apartment was found secured and intact with her purse inside. Her vehicle was parked in the underground garage at her building. Extensive investigation failed to uncover any information regarding her disappearance.

Teeth: False, Full upper and lower dentures

Case reference: 2014001046.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1990, the body of this middle-aged man was found on Gore Avenue in Vancouver, British Columbia. He died of complications related to chronic alcohol dependence.

Hair: Blonde, Long dark blonde hair with greying beard
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Young Life Creator brand
Shoes: Grey, Nike Air brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2018038616.CaseDesc: On July 9, 2018, Cameron Richard Betker was reported missing by family.

Case reference: 2014001028.CaseDesc: The body of this middle aged man was found in the Fraser River near Quesnel, British Columbia on May 20, 1968. He was well dressed and had custom orthotic supports in his shoes. He would have been born around 1920, had grey hair and likely had full dentures.

Other: Case, Leather case with nail clippers
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Pen Knife, Pen Knife
Leather, Black, Small key case with 15 keys
Shoes: Leather, Black, Pointed dress shoe with Dr.Scholl's arch support insole
Wallet: Brown, Light brown leather wallet with dark brown stitching

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2013000029.CaseDesc: On November 4, 1991, Montreal Police received a complaint from Mr. Katnick reporting that his daughter Leslie Anne Katnick was missing. Leslie Katnick had been residing in Montreal, Quebec until November 1, 1991, which was the last time she was seen by either friends or family. The investigation revealed that a Leslie Katnick registered into the Halifax YMCA on November 2, 1991, for several nights and returned the key on November 4, 1991. No further information has surfaced with respect to the whereabouts of Leslie Katnick. The circumstances of her disappearance are suspicious and foul play may be involved.

Case reference: 2014002414.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1983, Michael Milavanov and his father were canoeing on Kingsmere Lake near Waskesiu, SK. The canoe tipped over in rough water. His father survived however searches failed to locate Michael Milavanov.

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014005578.CaseDesc: On August 27, 1980, Alexander Calder was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. Mr. Calder was transient in nature, and frequented social service agencies in the downtown area of Edmonton. He was also known to frequent Edmonton’s river valley, and is described as having a cognitive impairment.

Case reference: 2014005770.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1979, Thomas Lidguerre and Lawrence Sanger headed out from Fond du Lac to Uranium City on Lake Athabaska, Saskatchewan. The boat was located two days later, swamped near the Narrows and Popular Point. A search was conducted and lasted for over one month without any success in locating Thomas and Lawrence.

Case reference: 2019007309.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2018, Robert Campbell was seen for the last time as he left work in Toronto, Ontario. Robert had not been seen for three months before he was reported missing.

Case reference: 2014000005.CaseDesc: Kenneth Chester FEHR was last seen on November 27th, 2012 at approximately 5:30 PM in the 1700 block of Idylwyld Drive North, Saskatoon, SK. He left behind his wallet and cell phone. Prior to leaving he told numerous family and friends good bye. He also spoke of harming himself.

Hair: Blonde, Wavy, Dirty blonde wavy hair down past his shoulders
Pants: Cotton, Grey, Sweat pants. Work clothes stained with tar
Shirt: Cotton, Black, Work clothes stained with tar.  Could be grey in colour

Case reference: 2014000020.CaseDesc: Lorraine Roach was last seen at home at approximately 1:30 a.m. on May 11, 2013, by her husband. He indicated that she was upset over a family matter and was heading to the local casino. She left driving her vehicle, which was later found parked on the side of the road near a walking trail about 7 kilometers from her home. She never went to the casino that evening.

Pierce: Ears, both ears have 3 piercings with diamond studs

Case reference: 2014002895.CaseDesc: Pierre Merasty grew up in the Lynn Lake area of MB and resided there until November of 1994 when he moved to Winnipeg, MB.  He lived with family and friends for a while prior to moving into a house in the downtown area of Winnipeg.  After he moved, he was never heard from again.  Mr. Merasty was known to frequent the Main Street bars and would usually walk anywhere he had to go.

Case reference: 2015059939.CaseDesc: On October 20, 1973, the remains of a male were recovered from the water near the Fleet Street Pumping Station, Ottawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being between 170-180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  It is estimated that he had been in the water between 2 and 3 months.

Case reference: 2006010599.CaseDesc: William Wabie was last seen as he departed in his 16 foot Starcraft boat from Bag Bay Peninsula, Shoal Lake, near Kenora, Ontario.  Mr. Wabie never arrived at his destination of Cedar Island.

Hat: Straw, Feather on the on side

Case reference: 2012020119.CaseDesc: On September 10, 1989, Francois Willey was seen for the last time in Chateauguay, Quebec. François has not been seen or heard from since.

Mark: Front Of Neck, Birthmark under Adam’s apple

Case reference: 2014005569.CaseDesc: Steven O’Brien was last seen on March 20, 1993. He was a first-year student at Holland College’s Culinary Institute in Charlottetown when he went missing after a night out with friends. Steven was last seen walking south on Queen Street in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, around 1:30 am.

Case reference: 2014005768.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2012, Sol Han was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Sol did not show up for school.

Case reference: 2011001699.CaseDesc: Justin Rutter left home on October 8, 2009 and failed to return.  He is known to frequent Lower Town in Ottawa, Ontario however, has not been seen in that area since that day. Justin may have met with foul play.

Coat: Beige, with white pattern on it
Mark: Right Cheek, 3 moles/freckles in the shape of a triangle

Case reference: 2013000058.CaseDesc: Marie-Berthe Perreault Astle Wiseman has been missing since June 26th 1975. She was last seen in her home located in the suburb of Pointe-Claire in Montreal, Quebec before mysteriously disappearring.

Case reference: 2013000053.CaseDesc: On October 20 2010, OPP were called to the Iroquois Locks, Iroquois ON by the Captain of a Bulk Laker reporting that crew member Gary Charlton had not shown up for his noon shift.  Crew members and the OPP conducted searches of the vessel without locating Charlton.  He was last seen on the vessel by crew members at 4:10 a.m., October 20, 2010 when the vessel was in Lake Ontario in the Cobourg area.

Case reference: 2022024689.CaseDesc: Luc Blanchette was last seen on June 2, 2022 at a gas station in the Radisson area of James Bay, Quebec. His 2018 white Honda Civic was found on June 3, 2022 near KM 503 of James Bay Road.

Case reference: 2014001545.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 6th of August 1979, Timothy Papik and his daughter Diane left Rankin Inlet, NU. heading towards Whale Cove, NU. in a canoe. They never reached their destination and they have not been seen since.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, Knife with snake, flower

Case reference: 2014004933.CaseDesc: On May 3, 1987, at approximately 7:00pm, Jimmy Hong was last seen by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. His friend indicated that Jimmy had left for Hamilton, Ontario, and would be returning the following Monday.

Case reference: 2015050965.CaseDesc: On October 29th, 1973 Kenneth Roy was reported missing from the Nepisiguit River area approximately 75-80 miles from Bathurst, New Brunswick. Kenneth had left to go on a hunting trip alone and was known to be an experienced woodsman.

Chain: Compass hanging on a shoelace and worn as a necklace
Hat: Red, Beige, Cap, Reversible to blue
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Timex, With expansion bracelet

Case reference: 2014004714.CaseDesc: In May 1975, William Lindsay was seen for the last time in Field, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, William, also known as Larry, had cashed in a federal tax refund cheque at a corner store. Prior to his disappearance in 1972, he had completed the Air Force’s basic training course (#7214) in Cornwallis, Nova Scotia, and then enrolled in the Communication Systems Tech course.

Scar: Cheek, Small crescent shaped on the left side

Case reference: 2007005299.CaseDesc: Shelley Mathieu-Read resided in Sarnia, Ontario. She was last seen on May 20, 2007 in Sarnia but has not been heard from since. An extensive investigation by the Sarnia Police Service has failed to locate her.

Scar: Forehead, from hairline running down into forhead
Tattoo: Right Foot, graphic of a star

Case reference: 2013000044.CaseDesc: Carole Roy, who also went by several aliases, was last seen in 1996 near Carlton Place, Ontario. Ms. Roy has lived in Carlton Place, Ottawa, and various places in Quebec. She was reported missing by her family.

Case reference: 2013000023.CaseDesc: Marilyn Ann Hersey left the Abbey Lane Hospital on January 28, 2006, and hasn't been seen since.  Marilyn is bi-polar and had to take medication for numerous ailments; she did not have her medication with her.

Case reference: 2014004896.CaseDesc: On September 22, 2002, Aiqiu Chen was seen for the last time as she was leaving her brother’s home in Toronto, Ontario. Aiqiu left with all of her belongings.

Case reference: 2020018574.CaseDesc: Steven WOYTOWICH is believed to be homeless and was last seen in the Beverly area of Edmonton, Alberta, in early March of 2020.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, lady on a mushroom

Case reference: 2014001111.CaseDesc: On February 7th, 1994, the remains of an adult male (25-50 years old), 5'10-6'0 tall, with a thin build, were located by land surveying students in a wooded area near the village of Anmore. The investigation determined the cause of death to be a self-inflicted gunshot wound. A black guitar case was found near the remains. He went missing sometime after May 1992.

Belt: Black, Blue, Fabric belt with a metal Indian Chief Belt buckle inscribed "HARA"
Jacket: Cotton, Blue, Blue with Green Gold piping sleeved Windbreaker Jacket
Pants: Nylon, Blue, Maroon, Sweat pants with zipper on cuffs
Shirt: Cotton, Grey, Black, Long Sleeved Sweatshirt

Case reference: 2014005046.CaseDesc: On June 10, 2007, at approximately 3:45 p.m., Remi Bouchard was seen for the last time on a floatation device in the Bow River near Calgary, Alberta. Remi disappeared into the water after being trapped at the base of the weir.

Case reference: 2006010299.CaseDesc: On November 11, 1970, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Edward Bucharest and his son, Barry Bucharest, were last seen by their family members in Kenora, Ontario. The pair had left from their cottage located on Kimberly Road, north shore of the Big Stone Bay in the municipality of Lake of the Woods, in a 14-foot fiberglass boat. The capsized boat, two life jackets, and other belongings were subsequently located.

Case reference: 2006018399.CaseDesc: David Sawyer and his girlfriend were last seen on May 17, 1977. They went fishing for the day on Pickerel Lake. Their capsized canoe was recovered but Mr. Sawyer has not been located. He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014006224.CaseDesc: In January 2013, Da Wang was seen for the last time by his fiancé in Buffalo, New York. However, the two continued to communicate through text messages for several months. On July 11, 2013, at approximately 7:18 p.m., Da’s fiancé received a final text message from him indicating that he was in trouble.

Case reference: 2014004671.CaseDesc: Murphy Quill was last seen in mid-July 2005. His family and friends are concerned for his well being as it is unusual for him to be out of contact for this length of time. Although he does not have a fixed address, Mr. Quill is known to frequent the Main Street strip and the area near 75 Martha Street in Winnipeg, MB.

Case reference: 2006025099.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1988, a Caucasian male, believed to be between the ages of 40-74, was recovered from the Otonabee River, south of Lock 19 in Peterborough. There were stains on his teeth, which suggests that he was a smoker. The remains could have been in the water for a few weeks to many years.

Teeth: Stained, Although he was missing most of his molars, his upper left third molar was carious and could have caused him significant pain.

Case reference: 2006009099.CaseDesc: John Samuel Clifford was last seen on October 10, 1987. He was fishing and hunting near Floods Landing, on Frederickshouse River, in the Township of Blount, District of Cochrane. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate him.

Boots: Rubber, Green, Red, construction safety boots
Coat: Wool, Green, Parka, hydro work jacket

Case reference: 2014002434.CaseDesc: On June 25, 1979, Lorraine Legault was seen for the last time as she played in front of the home of her grandparents in Montreal, Quebec.

Case reference: 2012020140.CaseDesc: Melina Martin of Sainte-Sabine was last seen on January 23, 2005 at 1:30 pm in the Bourbonnais park in Farnham.

Case reference: 2014002921.CaseDesc: Alban Robichaud has been missing since May 30, 1991. Alban was employed with City Laundry and left this day at 3pm. Alban was seen in various uptown Saint John pubs and was last seen at Gene's Country Palace between 11:00 & 11:30 pm.

Case reference: 2016066678.CaseDesc: On July 29, 1966, the remains of a male were recovered from the Maid of the Mist Landing, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 175-180 lbs and his length was measured at 5'11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Hair: Black, Short, Shorter than collar length, greying

Case reference: 2013000089.CaseDesc: Daniel Marceau was last seen on June 7, 1989 in Montréal. He was despondent, and told a friend that he was going up north to reflect on his life.

Case reference: 2008005999.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1978, Brian McLean and his co-worker, Russell Thomas, were commercial fishing at their camp on MacDowell Lake, near MacDowell Lake First Nation Territory. Mr. Thomas advised that they left in separate boats to lift nets. He went to the west side of the lake and pulled four nets, then to the east side of the lake and lifted two more nets. He then realized that Mr. McLean was not there. Mr. Thomas headed back towards the camp and found Mr. McLean’s boat washed up against the shore approximately three or four hundred metres from the camp. The motor was in forward gear with the throttle off, and the paddle was missing from the boat. MacDowell Lake is 90 "air miles" north of Red Lake, and is accessible only by air. The area was searched, and the lake was dragged, but Brian McLean has not been found.

Pants: Oilskin, Green, Coveralls with blue suspenders
Amputation: Right Foot, all toes except big toe left

Case reference: 2014002904.CaseDesc: On February 4, 1980, Marcel Lapointe was last seen at his residence in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005328.CaseDesc: In October 1986, Frances Neilson was observed by family leaving her residence in Edmonton, Alberta in the family vehicle. A few days later the vehicle was recovered but Frances has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003594.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1984, Pamela Asprey was last seen getting into a vehicle near the National War Memorial in St. John’s, Newfoundland. The male driver was described as having a large build and wore a baseball hat. That evening, Ms. Asprey had gone to a bar near where she was last seen. She had left her wallet at the bar and had advised her friend that she would be back in twenty minutes. Pamela was known to frequent the Duckwork Street area in St. John’s.

Tattoo: Shoulders, Greek writing on right shoulder

Case reference: 2012020165.CaseDesc: The remains of this male were found in a forested area immediately north of the Port Coquitlam cemetery.

Teeth: Visible Decay, Missing an upper front tooth on the left side prior to death. The upper front tooth on the right side was angled.
Deformity: Left Knee, Osgoode-Schlatter's disease - bony bump on shin below knee

Case reference: 2007002999.CaseDesc: Luciano Trinaistich was last seen at his residence on the 24th of July 2007 where he left and indicated that he was going to pick blueberries along Murphy Road near Timmins, Ontario. When he did not return home his wife contacted the Timmins Police Service and reported him missing. A search was conducted by the Timmins Police Service and the Ontario Provincial Police which resulted in locating the missing male's vehicle parked down a sideroad that runs off of Murphy Road. An extensive ground search has been conducted in the vicinity of the recovered vehicle with negative results.

Case reference: 2014004358.CaseDesc: On August 5, 2003 Rahul Arora was last seen leaving the Trappers Inn in Parry Sound, Ontario.  He was possibly heading to the Toronto area to catch a flight.

Hair: Black, Straight, Ear length, parted in middle, dyed copper

Case reference: 2014003136.CaseDesc: Linda Christian Pedersen was last seen at 9:15 a.m. on June 3, 1981 when she left her boyfriend's apartment in Victoria.  She reportedly returned to her own apartment before 11:30 a.m. and spoke to a male acquaintance.  Her whereabouts since that time are unknown.  Linda left behind all valuables and medication.  She was to have met a girlfriend at 4:30 p.m. but failed to show up for the meeting.  She was interested in theatre production and was reportedly meeting an actor during the evening of June 3, 1981.

Hat: Other, Frequently wore a dark-coloured beret

Case reference: 2008006899.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1966, Mr. Wynacht and two of his friends went hunting North of Sudbury along hydro pole lines, 20 miles north of Gauthiers corners on hwy 69, Kitchener Township. As a snow storm picked up, the hunters got separated along the pole lines, and Mr. Wynacht vanished. On the morning of Saturday November 5, 1966, a police cruiser led the search of the area with 35 citizens and two aircrafts. The search was completed on November 15, 1966, with negative results and no clue as to his disappearance had been uncovered.

Shirt: Wool, Red, Black, Checkered heavy doe skin

Case reference: 2013000012.CaseDesc: Cameron March was last seen by his mother on May 7, 1975, at approximately 3:15 p.m. He was playing on a swing set in a next door neighbour's yard located on Blind Line in the City of Burlington, Ontario. Cameron followed the adult neighbour into the residence and asked to play with a friend. When told the friend was sleeping, Cameron left the residence, walking towards his house.

Teeth: Braces, Braces on lower left side of teeth.  One top tooth discolored.
Shirt: White, T-shirt with green band around collar. Brown and green monkeys climbing on front.

Case reference: 2016068405.CaseDesc: On March 29, 1970, the remains of a male were found on the Lake Erie shore in Point Pelee National Park. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated that he had been in the water for approximately 1 week to 6 months prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2016060399.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1975, the skeletal remains of a male were found in the brush on Sparrow Lake Road (Lot 23 Con 14) in Orillia. His post-mortem length was recorded as being between 5'8"-5'9" however; this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  A pair of nail clippers was also found nearby. His death is estimated to have occurred in the spring or summer prior.

Teeth: No dental work, missing a few teeth in upper jaw.
Scarf: Orange, Knitted gold-coloured material, possibly a scarf or sweater
Shoes: Brown leather clog-type shoes with a raised Cuban heel, size 7-8
Tie: Red, white, and blue material with curved design - possibly a necktie or head band
Underwear: White, Undershirt with label, partial initials "MP" followed by "LAN", beneath these "PETTIN"

Case reference: 2016052152.CaseDesc: On September 13, 2016 at approximately 9:30 p.m., John Casey was seen for the last time aboard a cruise vessel in transit between Cap-aux-Meules and Havre Saint-Pierre, Quebec. John has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003937.CaseDesc: On February 14, 1990, Reynald Fortin was seen for the last time in the Verdun district of Montreal, Quebec. He was known to be despondent and to consume alcohol. Reynald left his apartment without his identification or money.

Case reference: 2012003299.CaseDesc: David Wardle lived alone in Wilberforce, Ontario. He worked off and on at a local mill and kept mostly to himself. During the fall of 1981, Mr. Wardle advised a family member that he had gotten into some trouble and would be leaving for awhile to get it straightened out. Approximately one week later Mr. Wardle and his truck were missing from his home. Family members are concerned for his well-being as his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2014003023.CaseDesc: Joseph Roussel was last seen climbing Mount Edith Cavell in Jasper National Park.

Case reference: 2014002821.CaseDesc: During the weekend of August 18, 1972, Dennis Simpson and a friend left for a fishing trip on McMillian Lake. When they failed to return by the 22nd, numerous people contacted police. Through investigation it was later determined that both men were last seen by a man on shore on Sunday the 20th, and their camp was still set up. They told the individual that they were going to make one more pass and then intended to break camp. Weather conditions at the time were such that there would have been rough water. Given this and the fact that the men were in a fairly small canoe, it was determined they may have capsized. An extensive land, water and air search did not find anything other than various articles that were identified as belonging to the two missing fishermen. Mr. Simpson has never been located.

Case reference: 2014006175.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, at approximately 5:30 a.m., Jason Bathily and his twin sister, Clarene Bathily, were seen for the last time with their mother, Adelyne Mounga, in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018051391.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2018, Himat Singh was last seen at the Ontario Khalsa Darbar Temple in Mississauga, Ontario.  Himat, who was in Canada on a Teaching Visa, packed a bag and was observed entering a vehicle with an unknown individual.
